Try picking random values of x, and read: Try picking random values of x, and reading off corresponding values of y from our (power law) straight line. Because of the spacing of the horizontal lines we see that we are most likely to get a value of y with first digit 1, then we are next likely to get a value of y with a first digit 2, etc. These probabilities are what leads to Benford's Law.
Benford's Law is used in the real world: Benford's Law is used in the real world to check for fraud on big data sets. If they don't follow the law when they should, it is possible they have been falsified!
